header.title: ITV Good Morning Britain: Piers Morgan in furious sexism row with Coronation Street star
header.subtitle: GOOD MORNING BRITAIN heated up this morning as Piers Morgan and Susanna Reid hosted Coronation Street star Nicola Thorp to discuss harassment and sexist photographers.
header.postText: Piers Morgan struggled to keep his cool on today’s Good Morning Britain, as he took on the actress who plays Nicola Rubinstein in Coronation Street.', 'Nicola recently wrote a column for Metro.co.uk which spoke about inappropriate photography on red carpets.', 'Nicola argued that the language used within articles online such as flashed the flesh and busty display, is toxic.', 'ITV’s morning show brought former News of the World deputy editor Neil Wallis to counter her points.', 'Nicola explained: I don’t wear it so people notice me. I’m on a red carpet because I was up for Best Newcomer at the British Soap Awards.', 'Piers countered: I get called ‘fat and useless’ all the time, so what’s the difference?', 'But Nicola agreed: I don’t think there is a difference, let me just say-', 'No, let me just say, Piers cut in.', 'But Susanna dove in to give Nicola her say: No, let Nicola finish!', 'Women can be sexist as well, Nicola continued.', 'Despite Susanna’s protests, Piers continued to talk over Nicola, causing her to plead: Please let me finish, Piers.', 'Neil eventually weighed on in the topic, asking: Are you sure you’re in the right profession?', 'But Nicola then began shouting over Neil, as Susanna and Piers attempted to allow him to have his say.', 'As the debate descended into chaos, Neil continued: The reason that Nicola goes on the red carpet is absolutely straight forward: she goes on the red carpet to publicise her career.', 'Piers furiously jumped in once more, saying: “What about Aidan Turner?', 'Why is it fine for women to drool over him ? ', '', '', 'It isn’t fine for women to do it.', 'It’s the language they use, and it’s their body, it’s their choice.', ' But Neil continued to disagree, saying that it was good promotion for her. ', 'Later on in the show Susanna asked Piers if he had anything to apologise for, to which he replied : No.
